that's still a bit confusing. Audacity and many other "sound editors" can record *sounds* from the microphone, and then let you do editing (copy&paste) as well as several effects on them. some will also let you work with multiple tracks. but those programs won't let you do *music*, they have no concept of "notes"
on the opposite side, there are MIDI-only programs that work with scores
but those generally have no synthesizer abilities
download the 32-bit one if you have to ask - that's my advice
